page.title: 10Carlton Weathering Centre
page.content: The Weathering Station is owned by Tioxide International who are the second largest TI02 pigment manufacturer in the world.This station is the largest site in Europe for testing pigment and paint.It was moved away from the poluted air of Billingham to the present open field site in 1957.Mr Oakley has run the station since its opening.There are only 4 people employed there now.Paint is tested for many companies including I.C.I and CROWN.28,000 samples of paint,mainly blue and white,are exposed to the weather on rows of racks.They test paint on different materials such as wood,metal,plastic and concrete (The racks facing North are wetter and mouldier) The information is used by the technical services department and the research chemists.The oldest paint is 15 years.
